subject: Re: [junit] Re: Junit and tibco or any EAI project Racoon
msgSnippet: Hi Jonathan, I m currently based in Paris, France and i m working as an J2EE/EAI Architect for a banking company, we re using the tibco suite in the market
messageBody:
Hi Jonathan,

I'm currently based in Paris, France and i'm working
as an J2EE/EAI Architect for a banking company, we're
using the tibco suite in the market division and have
our own sort of SDK based on TIB/Rendezvous. We choose
not to go with the TIB/Adapter SDK for various
reasons.

Anyway we're busy writing a test suite that publishes
messages and checks that under certain subjects we get
specific messages. Our idea is to automate testing and
check that at certain points in the process flow we
get specific messages. We don't beleive in the log
solution as doesn't really check the messages
themselves.

Initially we used jUnit and some custom code before we
started writing appenders for jUnit.

Regarding participation to the Raccoon framework we're
busy melting our stuff with the code from Cedric and
we're hoping to get all this stuff working together.
Basically i'm working on the Raccoon implementation
over TIB/Rendezvous whilst Cedric works on the Raccoon
implementation above the TIB/Adapter SDK.

The work isn't been sent back to the Sourceforge site
because TIBCO is hassling us, to put things rather
crudely. Raccoon is seen as unfair competition to
their TIB/Adapter SDK. I beleive that opensource of an
adapter SDK will improve TIB applications more than
anything else, they don't.

We're working with Cedric on an offline version and
we'll see once that's working how we can put things on
the web site without TIBCO sueing us :o(
You'll notice for example that the javadoc for the
TIB/Adapter SDK that was written by a couple of
developpers was removed from the site ...

As for the bugs, i think you should inform the Raccoon
developers so that they can improve the code :o)

Regards,

Blue.

ps: Blue is my first name, Avenger isn't though ;o)
DarkBlueAvenger is my gaming nickname, if you ever
feel play Diablo II online ... you can find me on the
european servers, occassionaly on the West Coast
servers.

--- jlhoward_nz <jlhoward_nz@...> wrote:
> Dear dba
>
> Greetings oh dark and blue. The project we are
> working on involves taking initial code from an
> external vendor, writing tests for it and then
> adding
> new functions onto it. We initially investigated
> Raccoon and Tibco but found that it was a little
> buggy. We are very keen to continue on the path of
> Junit, Tibco etc. At the moment we have a rather
> crude automated testing framework that compares log
> files using other technologies such as ant, text
> file
> comparison utility to test IM workflows. We are
> currently looking at how to test adapters and make
> sure they are successful. Are you contributing the
> Racoon code back to the site or not. Let me know
> and
> I can send you some more information. Where are you
> based?
>
> Regards
>
> Jonathan Howard
>
>
>
>
> --- darkblueavenger <darkblueavenger@...>
> wrote:
> > Hi Howard,
> >
> > We're using jUnit, Raccoon and TIBCO Active
> > Enterprise currently in
> > our projet.
> > We're busy extending the jUnit extensions found in
> > Raccoon so as to
> > test the full TIB/IM workflows in an automated
> > fashion
> > Currently we're delving on having xml config files
> > to have Raccoon
> > send and record intermediate steps.
> >
> > What are you doing ?
> >
> >In junit@y..., "jlhoward_nz" <jlhoward_nz@y...>
> wrote:
> > Has anybody being using JUNIT to test EAI projects
> like Tibco or
> > Vitria or MQ series. We are currently building a
> framework around
> > Tinco using Junit and racoon and would be most
> interested in swapping
> > notes and improving the community with some good
> knowledge.
>
>
>
